stories.text: I've come to love Julia programming during my PhD and I'd love to go back to it. However I'm struggling to find any company using it (UK). Is going back to academia the only solution?
stories.title: Ask HN: Any company using Julia (and hiring)?
Automating SQL user generation and password rotation with CockroachDB

stories.text:
I know that many of you will say Ruby is doing fine, etc... let me say that regarding jobs and adoption is not that great, especially compared to Python and a few others, without even looking at usage stats.

However, I see some attractive features in Ruby 3, do you think that's enough to get a comeback?

My main concern is jobs availability, as an employer I find it harder and harder to find good RoR developers and they become super expensive. As a startup you're start to think if you made a big mistake choosing Ruby , even if it's easier to build something, being so hard to find affordable developers offsets every advantage you had.
stories.title: Ask HN: Will Ruby Get a Comeback?
A real-world introduction to event-driven architecture
I Track My Tasks in Obsidian

stories.text:
Source: https://builtformars.com/case-studies/ps5-vs-xbox

It's pretty damning...

"The natural conclusion here would be to pick a winner. But that'd feel unfairly divisive, given that my opinion is that both consoles have terrible user experiences.

If you wrote a list of all the software that you use on a daily basis (Google Docs, Mac Mail, IOS, Twitter, TikTok...), they'd probably all be better than either consoleâ€”and considerably so.

Both the Playstation and Xbox lack empathetic design or any real onboarding, and they make hundreds of obvious UX mistakes. For example:

- Not auto-focusing on fields when there's only one field / action on the screen.

- Not auto-proceeding between the month and day fields in a date-picker.

- Empty states without actions (e.g., "no WiFi connected" without a link to connect the WiFi).

- Poorly-labelled settings (e.g., the difference between Playstation's 'Avatars' and 'Profile pictures').

- Basic functionality requires customer service (e.g., cancelling a pre-order on Playstation)."
stories.title: Playstation's dashboard is 30% less efficient than Xbox's
A guide to designing accessible, WCAG-compliant focus indicators
